thread.title: Manchester City jet off to Abu Dhabi immediately after thrilling Champions League win over Monaco
thread.title_full: Manchester City jet off to Abu Dhabi immediately after thrilling Champions League win over Monaco

author: Alex Richards
title: Manchester City jet off to Abu Dhabi immediately after thrilling Champions League win over Monaco
text:
Sport Manchester City jet off to Abu Dhabi immediately after thrilling Champions League win over Monaco City are heading to the Far East for warm weather training, with club officials also set to meet up with Sheikh Mansour Share City boss Pep Guardiola at Manchester Airport (Photo: Allan Bentley/Cavendish Press) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester City stole a Champions League victory on Tuesday night against French league leaders Monaco before immediately leaving the scene of the crime, flying out of the country. 
Pep Guardiola’s side twice came from behind to land a 5-3 first leg victory, in a staggering game at the Etihad Stadium. 
And within hours of their success, the Premier League side were checking in at Manchester Airport, ahead of their trip to Abu Dubai. 
City are not in action this weekend, having seen their clash with rivals United postponed due to the Red Devils involvement in the EFL Cup final on Sunday. Raheem Sterling, Ilkay Gundogan and Vincent Kompany head out (Photo: Allan Bentley/Cavendish Press) Two-goal hero Sergio Aguero chats to fans (Photo: Allan Bentley/Cavendish Press) Gael Clichy didn't play against Monaco (Photo: Allan Bentley/Cavendish Press) Raheem Sterling and Leroy Sane both scored on the night (Photo: Allan Bentley/Cavendish Press) Read More Pep Guardiola praises his Man City side for coming from behind to beat Monaco 
Therefore City are taking advantage of having no game until their FA Cup replay with Huddersfield next Wednesday by heading to the Far East for a warm weather training camp. 
City are expected to make use of the training facilities in the grounds of the five-star Emirates Palace Hotel, in a visit that will also allow staff and players to meet club owner Sheikh Mansour. 
Club officials elected that it would make more sense to head out immediately after last night’s game, rather than send the players home post-game, only to meet up again and jet out today. Pablo Zabaleta came off the bench to play a key role (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Guardiola chats with Serbian defender Aleksandar Kolarov (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Otamendi found his way to the airport after a horrible night (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Goalkeeper Willy Caballero (Photo: Allan Bentley/Cavendish Press) Read More Pep Guardiola admits Manchester City must score in Monaco 
Guardiola's men are in pole position to land a place in the Champions League quarter-finals, after a helter-skelter game against Monaco. 
However the Spaniard has already warned his side will be unable to claim a clean sheet in the Principality when the clubs meet in the second leg - insisting they must play on the front foot once more. 
“We are going to fly to Monaco to score as many goals as possible," said Guardiola. "We are not going to defend that result. 
“We now know each other better. We will adjust some things, they will adjust some things but we have to score goals. If we don't score a goal in Monaco we will be eliminated. 
“Of course I am happier than my colleague from Monaco but at 2-0 (two behind) we are out. And if one team can score a thousand million goals it's Monaco." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
